wikipedia_page.main: James William Barke (22 May 1905 - 20 March 1958) was a Scottish novelist.

response: *The Merry Muses of Caledonia, with James Barke and John DeLancey Ferguson (Edinburgh: M. Macdonald, 1959).

link_mentions.page: The Wind That Shakes the Barley
response: * The Wind That Shakes the Barley is also a novel by James Barke about the Scots poet Robert Burns; it was published in 1946, the first of a quintet of novels on the subject.
| Poems and Songs of Robert Burns || Robert Burns || James Barke || 1955
* The Merry Muses of Caledonia. with James Barke and Sydney Goodsir Smith. New York: Putnam, 1959.

A further edition of the poems was published in 1959, the title page reading: edited by James Barke and Sydney Goodsir Smith, with a Prefatory Note and some authentic Burns Texts contributed by John DeLancey Ferguson.  Like the 1911 edition, this one contextualised the poems.  The Merry Muses was intended to be accompanied by music, and this 1959 edition was intended to include music.  Unfortunately, it was left incomplete owing to the death of Barke.
